reviews.title: Good old-fashioned service with efficiency and care

Whilst I also have a bonus online account, the branch is a mainstay of our local high street. The range of accounts can meet almost every need and have attractive competitive interest rates.

reviews.title: Right for me
reviews.text: The Nottingham BS easy access account is just right for me as it allows me to withdraw funds when I need to but I have to keep £1000 in the account to keep it up and running. The interest rate is 1.05% variable AER which is better than the 0.33% referred to in your article.

reviews.title: 5 year fixed rate ISA.
reviews.text: Took the chance to take the 5 year fixed rate ISA. Only available for a short time in the 25/26 window. A market leading rate at the time. I was previously had a beehive savings product which transferred over automatically. As an existing app user I opened the account in minutes and deposited without issue on the same day. It seemed a prudent move given the uncertain future of cash ISAs.

reviews.title: All the staff are friendly, helpful, knowledgeable.
reviews.text: All the staff are friendly, helpful, knowledgeable. Put you at ease straight away in a relaxed & friendly atmosphere. Drink offered, toilets available too. Nothing too much trouble. Communications are excellent, either by post, email or phone,updating on products available, end dates, next steps etc etc. Used by the whole family, my mum, me & my children for a number of years now & we have all been very happy with all our various transactions, advice etc.

reviews.title: One very happy chappy!
reviews.text: I was completely new to the concept of Lifetime ISAs and money management, and they made it so simple for me, not only to understand and come to terms with, but to manage and engage with it afterwards as well! During a moment of emotional difficulty, they were incredibly supportive and understanding on the phone, and helped me to understand my options at the time. Their online portal and their App are really easy to use as well, informative and intuitive.

reviews.text: Since joining with Nottingham Building Society, I have nothing but good things to say about them. I started a fixed rate Lifetime ISA with them about a year or so ago. The process was simple to set up and I felt like I had a lot of support along the way, especially in terms of understanding the ins and outs of my new savings account. I would recommend them to anyone looking to save toward their future, whether that be for their first home, their children's higher education, or anything else. :)

I had never transferred an ISA before so was a bi wary but the online instructions made it simple and i received regular updates regarding the status of transfer which made it stress free On one occasion I was unable to log in and phoned customer support who, after checking informed me that the site appeared down, the staff member was very reassuring and took the time to phone me back to tell me things were now working and I could log in

reviews.text: The LISA is a fantastic way to build a deposit for a first time buyer. You gain interest and get 25% government bonus, giving you the opptunity to save £10000 in only 2 years. It has been a great tool for me to build my deposit

reviews.title: I’m so glad I opened a LISA!
reviews.text: I have had a Lifetime ISA for 3 years. It was free to open my account and I get sent reminders and updates related to the tax year and interest rates. I have saved so much in this time (max amount) that if I continue for another 3 years I will have enough for a deposit on a house, even on a low income. I think the bank and scheme is fantastic, and having the 25% bonus removed if you withdraw money is a great way to never spend it. It’s also very easy to navigate, on the website and on the app. I trust this company, having found all the legal paperwork easy to understand with no catch. Due to my recommendations my family have also opened LISA’s with this bank. This service is opening doors for people that normally would’ve never been able to afford a house.

reviews.text: Market leading rate easy-access rate which was easy to apply for in the app. Good experience overall, though withdrawals take 1 working day which can mean slow access to the money if it's the weekend. I would still recommend though as they are reliable and have good products.

reviews.text: Very clear, easy and straightforward to navigate their website. Telephone calls are answered promptly and staff are helpful, polite and knowledgeable. I chose Nottingham Building Society for an easy access savings account because of the high interest rate but I shall continue to use them for the reasons above.

reviews.title: Easy to use
reviews.text: A year ago I opened what was then a Beehive savings account, at what was a good rate of interest. Although the variable rate decreased several times, Beehive always gave good advance warning. Transfers out were very easily done, and the phone app super easy to use.

reviews.text: Although I can do most tasks online, it's good that if you do go into the branch, the staff are friendly and helpful. Rates are good for a local building society.

reviews.title: six month bond
reviews.text: Useful six month at competitive interest rate that seamlessly renewed. Shame this does not look likely to be repeated.

reviews.title: Professional, polite and easy to manage my finances!
reviews.text: I’ve only had to speak to customer services on 2 occasions as my accounts are app based. Extremely professional and pleasant advisors. Promptly dealing with things for me. One was to safeguard my account as I was on holiday and had lost my phone. The level of panic was unreal and they put me at ease and reassured me everything was fine and added security to my account. Interest rates are very competitive also. I would happily move more of my finances over. Very easy to deal with.

reviews.title: I've done everything by the app, so haven't called o...

reviews.title: Good rates, great choice, excellent service.
reviews.text: I am very pleased with the rate I am receiving. Nottingham Building Society has proved a safe and rewarding place to invest part of my inheritance. I am very happy with the service I get and will certainly recommend you to friends and family with money to invest.

reviews.title: Remortgage
reviews.text: They can’t be bothered to do it themselves so pass you off onto a company called Optima, which isn’t made clear in the initial process. This company is shocking and Nottingham are nearly even present in the whole process!

reviews.title: good interest rates
reviews.text: interest rates on their esaver accounts are good & amongst best on market for instant access & easy to set up new account

reviews.title: Do not recommend
reviews.text: Throughout my whole experience which has been a little under 12 months I have experienced nothing but problems. Unfortunately in my experience the broker I was dealing with liked to work at their own pace, as an example it took them 2 weeks to send off my proofs for approval and had no real reason as to why apart from 'I have been in meetings' Their communication was shocking throughout and since I have logged my last complaint about the process I have never heard from her since. Regrettably I have recommended 2 of my friends to use the Nottingham (this was before the problems started) and they have also experienced issues. One of them went to the bank instead after being messed around with proofs and the other is battling through. The only positive is they have no fees and one of the case handlers (Shaz) is about the only person who follows up when they say they will or completes anything in a prompt time frame. I would never consider using or recommending them again.

reviews.title: Bureacratic and poorly run
reviews.text: Moved my savings here after finding them on a maoney-saving site. Offered a good interest rate on an online account. I wanted instant access as am doing up my house and need to pay builders etc. Have tried to move funds to a current account but was made to jump through hoops: forms to be filled in which then had to be certified. Luckily, I have a friend who is a doctor so was able to get this done free of charge. Forms were all sent via snail mail which defeats the object of an online account. Hence, this took days rather than the minutes when amending details on a laptop. Forms also failed to arrive. I've asked them to close the account now. So, the 'instant' access has taken almost a month now. Oh, and they manged to leave a £1000 of mine in a 'suspended' account which made me even more frantic as I'd thought it had been lost. What is more, while they do pick up the phone quickly, you are then left on hold for 5-10 minutes which is far too long when you're paying for the call.

reviews.title: The rates offered for savings are very good compared...
reviews.text: The rates offered for savings are very good compared to other banks and building societies and after the fixed term expired, I was able to put my savings into a variable savings account with rates that are above other financial institutions. Kept informed on new rates by emails, so I could plan for my future savings as well.
